headline: Junior Devops Engineer
description.text: Description   The role is to actively take part in the continuous development and delivery of LRS Output (Print) Management Software products.The DevOps engineer will be responsible for developing and maintaining the release management process with focus on automating the continuous integration and continous delivery pipelines (CI/CD).Typical responsibilities are to engage in Coding, Building, Testing, Packaging, Configuring and Monitoring activities for both traditional of the shelf software products as well as Software as a Service (SaaS) products in a cloud environment.As a DevOps engineer you will be part of one or more development teams to deliver evolving products to meet the ever changing needs of our customers.   This is a junior position where commitment and willingness to learn and explore is vital.If you are a DevOps (or a future DevOps) engineer, team player and up for challenges, this is the right place for you.   Your responsibilities:   Be responsible for analysis, design, implementation and maintenance of the DevOps toolchain (Code, Build, Test, Package, Release, Configure, Monitor)   Participate in improving the development processes, evaluate and suggest tools, workflows, technologies etc.

headline: AWS and DevOps Engineer in the .NET area
description.text: Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions.IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.   At Product Development IT, we are responsible for the design, development, implementation and maintenance of IT solutions for R&D.The work environment is international and our employees are representing many different nationalities and countries.To this exciting and dynamic environment we are now looking for new IT-professionals, irrespective of where you live within Sweden.   If you are a Senior Full-Stack Developer and have a significant interest in .NET development and agile working methods, then maybe this could be the right challenge for you.   Your responsibilities   Most of our solutions are business critical and requires high performance and high maintainability.The focus areas ahead are to further develop the solutions with modern cloud-based technology and improve automation of tests.   You will be part of a development team where you will be working with a focus on development deliverables, system requirements, testing, support and release management.   As a senior developer with a background in AWS, you will play an important role in building our new application in Amazon Cloud & the lift-and-shift of our existing applications to AWS.You will ensure that our solutions are built with good software architecture and will continuously improve the way of working.   You’ll have tons of opportunity to expand your skills and apply those skills to interesting new problems.We are very excited about the DevOps space and eager to apply these principles and tools to deliver better software.In this growing and emerging field staying up to speed and learning new tools is part of the job.   Your profile   We are looking for a full-time .NET Full stack developer who has significant experience in Amazon AWS and DevOps.You should have a degree in IT, complemented with a minimum of 5 years development experience with at least 1-2 years’ experience in AWS.   It is meritorious if you have experience in .NET Core and micro-service architecture.   • We expect applicants to be curious, have excellent problem-solving skills and to have a genuine interest in developing good IT solutions.   • You’ll need to have excellent communication skills to be able to keep everyone in your team on the same page.   • You know how to plan your work like a pro and hit all your deadlines.By taking the time to plan each project effectively, you can become an invaluable asset to your company and yourself.   • It is an advantage if you have worked/are working in a lead role.   • As the corporate language is English, you need to be proficient in written and spoken English.   Our development culture   We are a medium-sized team that moves fast and iterates.We run code reviews, testing, and are currently working on achieving a continuous deployment infrastructure on Amazon Cloud.We put a lot of emphasis on code style, cleanliness and robustness.You will get to work with excellent engineers and you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on our way of working, vision and IT targets.   You will get to work with the latest technologies out there and continuously improve our processes and deliverables.We will never limit your creativity, never shut down ideas before testing them with customers and we will never be boring!   We embrace distributed development as a core tenant of our corporate philosophy.When a project requires collaboration we use shared workspaces, screen sharing, and voice over the internet to enable real-time discussions.   If this sounds like a team you’d love be a part of building, and you’ve got the skill set, please get in touch with us.We’d love to hear from you!   We offer   In addition to exciting career and personal development opportunities, we offer Scania employees a competitive salary and other benefits, performance bonuses, a pension plan, flexible working hours and much more.   Additional information      Application   Your application should include a cover letter and resume.Please apply no later than December 16th, 2018.

headline: Drifttekniker / DevOps till värdedrivet It-bolag
description.text: Vi expanderar och behöver stärka upp vår IT-operations.Du kommer att arbeta mycket självständigt, vägledd av vår IT-chef, och ansvara för att underhålla och kontinuerligt förbättra vår infrastruktur (servrar och nätverk) och optimera lösningar för säkerhet, tillgänglighet och prestanda, samt sköta drift, felsökning och monitorering av våra miljöer.   Du kommer att underhålla och förbättra vår deploymentprocess och stötta våra utvecklingsteam i hur de efterföljer processen samt med din infrastuktursexpertis.   Du kommer att hjälpa våra anställda med tekniska spörsmål, som hur de sätter upp e-post, datorer, etc.   Ditt jobb inkluderar att planera och genomdriva lösningar som förenklar och effektiviserar alla dessa uppgifter.Du kommer att ha möjlighet att läras upp och växa in i och utveckla rollen tillsammans med oss.   Teknisk flora   Nätverk:   •	Nätverkshårdvara (Edge-Core, Unifi AP)   •	WLAN (Unifi, Radius, WPA2 Enterprise)   •	Switching (Cumulus Linux, VLAN, STP)   •	Routing (Linux router)   •	Other (IPv6, IDS: Suricata, DNS: BIND9, HTTP/HTTPS, SMTP/IMAP, DHCP, iptables)   Servrar:   •	Serverhårvara (Dell PowerEdge)   •	Configuration Management (SaltStack)   •	Access and Authorisation Management (LDAP/AD: slapd, Samba 4, GOsa)   •	VPN (OpenVPN)   •	Other (IPMI, UPS; APC Smart UPS and apcupsd)   •	Backup (Amanda)   •	Virtualization (Ganeti, Xen)   •	Linux Server (Debian)   •	Windows Server 2016   •	Shell Scripting (Bash)   •	Programming (Python, PHP)   •	Webbservrar (Apache, Nginx)   •	DBA (MySQL, MariaDB)   •	E-post (Postfix, Dovecot, Spamassassin, SOGo)   •	Kalendrar (CalDAV, CardDAV, ActiveSync, SOGo)   •	Monitorering (Icinga, Grafana)   •	ITIL (iTop)   •	Filservrar (OwnCloud)   •	SCM (Git)   •	SDLC (Jenkins, GitLab CI, Docker, SaltStack)   •	Loggning (Syslog, Sentry)

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: We’re looking for experienced DevOps Engineers to join our Tech Department.You will be the crucial bridge between development and operations where you will continue to build and operate our infrastructure environment.      Go where the people speak your language      Security is crucial in your daily work, since we handle financial data and have to comply to PCI-DSS rules and regulations.      All in all, you'll be a part of a young, agile and modern company that always strives for better and more reliable technical solutions.      Your responsibilities will include:      - Making sure that our systems run smooth, troubleshooting any problems and solving them permanently   - Working closely with our tech teams and manage the operation and infrastructure requests   - Playing an important part in bringing our operations team to the next level.      Who are we looking for      We are looking for someone with a curious mind, that continuously wants to learn new technologies.You have a great interest for infrastructure and operations.Furthermore, you possess the ability to work independently in a fast-paced organization.As an easy going and self-motivated person you'll be joining a small team of committed colleagues who are working to change and democratize the payments world.      The skills you need to succeed      - Linux experience   - Relevant education and degree.   - Programming, backend (Scripting languages/object oriented)   - Automation skills and experience      Nice to have      - Understanding of distributed systems   - Amazon experience   - Nosql database (ex Cassandra) skills   - Web application firewall knowledge   - Experience working with PCI-DSS compliant infrastructures      Small minds never helped small businesses      It takes originality and an open mind to start a small business.That’s why small minds have no place in ours.At iZettle, we celebrate the individuality of the people we work with, valuing the impact that diverse experiences, backgrounds, perspectives and ideas can have on our culture and the products we build.We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer, a place where everyone can benefit from equal access to professional development and bring their whole personality to work.      We’re iZettle.      iZettle is on a mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants.Founded in Stockholm in 2010, we revolutionised mobile payments with the world’s first mini chip card reader and software for mobile devices.Today iZettle’s commerce platform for small businesses in Europe and Latin America provides tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow your business.We’re more than 500 employees of 45 different nationalities operating in 12 countries, and we’re recruiting the best and brightest from around the world to help us grow further.      Bring your talent to our attention      Go on, hit apply and say hello!      LI-POST

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Are you looking for a unique career opportunity?We are a Stockholm based technology developer and we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team.You will assist with the development and maintenance of critical infrastructure.   This is a hybrid position in that you will work part-time with traditional sysadmin (Systems Administration) tasks on our legacy platform.         Your Profile:   Infrastructure Support   •      Experience with automation/configuration management tools or the desire to learn them   •      Knowledge of best-practices in an always-up, always-available service   •      Ability to design and implement CI/CD pipelines   •      Understanding or experience in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) architecture      Programming   •      A working understanding of writing code (Python and/or Java is a plus)   •      Ability to execute tests and assist in pinpointing code problems   •      Ability to design and implement automated test environments   •      Strong foundation in source code management and version control (Git)      Systems administrator with strong knowledge/experience in:   •      Linux (Ubuntu/Debian) headless administration   •      TCP/IP networking and DNS routing   •      Virtualization and VM administration (docker etc..)   •      Manual (legacy) code deployments      What You’ll Do   Developing & Building (60%)   •      Design, create, support, and troubleshoot production infrastructure in Google GCP including optimizing deployment and automated test pipelines   •      Ensure compliance with security standards by performing regular tasks including patching infrastructure and reviewing system alerts   •      Identify and fix infrastructure bugs or bottleneck issues      Systems Administration (30%)   •      Keep an eye on legacy systems by overseeing monitoring and performing fixes where needed   •      Assist in the ongoing tasks of improving legacy infrastructure by migrating to cloud solutions   •      Support the legacy software developers in code deployments      Planning and Team Engagement (10%)   •      Work collaboratively with software development teams   •      Get involved with company-wide research and planning meetings on all infrastructure      About you   We are hiring dynamic individuals - always looking to improve themselves and their projects.Having the ability to be flexible and flourish in a fast-paced atmosphere while remaining focused, working productively, and successfully juggling many tasks is imperative.   We also look for individuals with the ability to take initiative and work independently with very little supervision - you will report directly to the head of technology.      About Us   ICSS was founded in 2005 as the pioneer of the Product Reviews aggregation and analysis sector.We collect, structure, match, analyze, present and syndicate product and review data, globally.   Our team is diverse, coming from every continent except Antarctica.We welcome all nationalities and backgrounds - provided that you are legally employable in Sweden.Our company language is English.alaTest headquarters are in Central Stockholm with a beautiful view over the Riddarfjärden, Old Town and City Hall.   Please reference 'DevOps Engineer' in the subject line.   Note: We require a small coding challenge to be completed by all applicants that pass the first review round.

headline: Devops Engineer
description.text: Who we are   We are a small fast-growing company and a family.We are continuously taking market shares and are among the leading companies in the Nordics at building smart recrutiment tools.What all ReachMees have in common is a passion for simplifying our users' lives and helping them succeed in their jobs - to find the right talent for their own companies and recruit them effectively, professionally and fairly.In that, the development process is central to our future growth and expansion outside the Nordic region.   The role   In the role as a Devops Engineer at ReachMee you will work together with our engineering teams to design, build and maintain our infrastructure, delivery pipeline and monitoring capabilities as well as the various tools we use to operate our technical platform.You will work in an agile environment with a strong focus on automation, reliability and continuous improvement.This role involves a lot of responsibility in designing and taking our technical platform to the next level.   As a team we also emphasize learning and development and meet in hackathons, book circles, tech lunches and in our Meetup-group TeachMee where we host talks about Python.All suggestions are welcome and we keep adding new interesting things as we go along.   Who are you?   For this role we imagine that you have a few years of previous experience within DevOps.As a person, you have a proactive and quality-oriented mindset, are eager to learn and have a strong drive to constantly improve things.You enjoy working in a cooperative and cross-functional environment and are generous in providing support and sharing knowledge with your colleagues.   Required skills:   • Continuous Integration in Jenkins or similar   • Linux and networks   • Cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud or Azure   • Basic programming skills, for example in Python, Ruby, Go or Java   • Knowledge of automation platforms such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef or Terraform   • Security   About ReachMee   Our over 600 customers are from both the private and public sectors and the solution is used by large as well as smaller companies, including McDonalds, Försvarsmakten, Sweco, Chalmers University, Apoteket, Scania and Vapiano.ReachMee has its headquarters in Stockholm, but we are also located in Oslo, Helsinki and Kiev.

Happy Socks is now looking for a DevOps Engineer to join their Digital Product Team in E-commerce who will take on the responsibility for digital architecture.You will be part of a happy and extremely driven multicultural company of approximately 120 people from 25 countries, based at Happy Socks’ HQ, in Stockholm, Sweden. headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Plejd AB is looking for a DevOps/CloudOps engineer to join our developer team in Göteborg/Mölndal.      Ideally you enjoy a healthy mix of back-end development, Linux and open-source wizardry and a love for all things DevOps, automation and cloud security.      Come join us if you share our passion for working on cutting edge technology and want to help enable our vision to make the best smart lighting and home automation system in the industry.      Plejd is an awesome fast growing Swedish tech company that develops products and services for smart lighting and home automation.We are an in-house fullstack company that has a great mix of people from production, hardware devs, embedded devs, app developers and cloud/backend devs.      You will like it here if you:   -Have an interest in designing and developing next generation cloud infrastructure for highly scalable and available cloud applications   -Like keeping up with state of the art technology and the ever growing ecosystem around open-source, cloud-native and DevOps   -Are hands-on and thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment where you will be a key member of the team      You will mostly be:   - Evaluating overall production infrastructure in the areas of web services, database, and others in AWS environment.   - Helping to seamlessly scale production level systems   - Creating secure AWS based solutions and independently implement them in a timely manner   - Developing monitoring and logging solutions   - Monitoring performance and stability for our cloud-platform and proactively resolve issues as they arise   - Collaborating with internal development teams to create requirements and deliver solutions      We do not except you to know everything in the list below but it may serve as a good list of reference for some of the technologies you will need to learn or know about:      Cloud Architect experience in the areas of:   - Deployment automation   - High availability systems   - Cloud security   - Key/configuration management   - AWS CloudFormation   - Serverless architecture   - ElastiCache (including Redis)   - NodeJS environments   - ElasticSearch      HTTP and Network protocol knowledge:   - Load balancers   - Reverse proxies   - NATs, DNS, VPNs   - WebSockets   - REST APIs      Monitoring and Logging:   - ELK stack administration   - CloudWatch   - NewRelic      Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery technology:   - Jenkins   - GitLab CI/CD pipelines      If this seems like the kind of environment you would like to work in, get in touch!      Plejd AB is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity.Please, no phone calls or emails.

headline: DevOps Technician
description.text: For the support of our IT Operations team, we are looking for a driven DevOps technician.      The ideal candidate for this position possesses hands-on experience working with DevOps tools as well as a good knowledge of software development.      The day-to-day in this position will include tasks such as monitoring the environments, automating the build pipeline, troubleshooting applications and production releasing, in order to ensure Cabonline's continued delivery of excellence.      We manage Cabonline's core applications which are written in Java.These applications run on Gigaspaces' in-memory platform XAP or in Docker as microservices.Infrastructure, hosts and applications are automated using Ansible.Our system environment is Linux based and we’re using GoCD as a continuous delivery/integration server.      If you would love to play a key role in the expansion of a fast-growing company, this might be your chance!      Required Qualifications       - Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience    - Genuine interest in learning new technologies    - Experience with    - - Linux systems    - - Scripting languages (e.g.Bash, Python)    - - Automation tools such as Ansible    - - Monitoring tools    - - DevOps tools (e.g.Git, Jira)    - - Databases (Postgres, MongoDB)?      Desired Qualifications       - Programming experience in Java    - Basic knowledge of Networks    - Knowledge or experience of    - - VMWare    - - CI/CD tools (e.g.    - - Windows systems    - - Cloud service (e.g.AWS)    - - Service discovery and microservice architecture (e.g.Consul, Nomad, Docker, Kafka)      Extra plus       - Knowledge or experience in Gigaspaces' XAP      In addition to the qualifications above, having a proactive mindset and the capacity to make decisions autonomously is essential to thrive in this position.      Sounds like a good fit for you?Apply in 1 minute through the link below with your CV or LinkedIn profile.      Cabonline Group offers flexible, world-class transportation services.With leading technology, we simplify the process for both transporters, drivers and customers by helping them find the perfect match when and where it is needed.      We target the public sector, private companies, transporters, drivers and customers, providing educated and service-oriented drivers, administrative support, seamless technology and efficient management.Our efficient booking services are used by hundreds of thousands of customers throughout the Nordics and provide a user experience beyond the ordinary.      Taxi ordering made easy      Our apps and web solutions are setting a new standard for taxi booking and payment.We have the best B2B platform on the market for both large and small companies.      Traffic management      Taxi systems made ready to use.By offering effective traffic management systems, we ensure a higher utilization rate and quick delivery.Our service centers are staffed 24/7.      Systems for drivers & cabs      The most complete services for cab drivers on the market.Taximeters, payment terminals, navigation and support systems that put the driver back into the driver's seat.      Our brands      Cabonline Group is one of Europe's leading technology and service provider for the taxi and transport industry.In Sweden, Finland and Norway, around 3 500 transporters are connected with approximately 7 000 vehicles under different brands, including TaxiKurir, Sverigetaxi, TOPCAB, Taxi Skåne, NorgesTaxi, Kovanen and FixuTaxi.

description.text: Missa inte möjligheten att jobba för ett spännande bolag.Med högt i tak, kompetenta kollegor och spännande kunder erbjuds du en tjänst med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter.Devinix jobbar med marknadsledande teknologier inom drift med en svensk molntjänst som de kallar DVXcloud.Devinix hjälper företag inom finans, fastighet, bank mm. att bygga framtidens IT plattformar.Din roll som drifttekniker kommer innebära övervakning, patching och drift av servrar (Windows/Linux).I din roll kommer du arbeta både på Devinix och ute hos kund. headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: ALTEN is looking for a DevOps Engineer for an exciting assignment for one of our clients.         You will work on site for one of our clients in the telecom industry.You will be in a team that run initiatives for the IT- and digital products in Sweden, like their public web, commercial and self-service solutions.You will be in a team that develops new products from start to finish and create services that bring value to the customers help achive the buisness goals.       You will be in a team responsible for system management and QA.The team is composed of Quality Assurance Engineers, Incident & Problem Managers and DevOps.      They are looking for a DevOps Engineer with a background from development who doesn't think great is enough!      Role Description      As a DevOps Engineer you will work with implementing and maintaining the right tools to ensure smooth and seamless IT-deliveries with high quality.This is done by standardizing processes, stabilizing infrastructure, enabling automation and reducing human intervention.Your responsibilities include:      - Cloud infrastructure: Automation, configuration, deployment, monitoring      - CI/CD: Automated build, test and deployment of applications and services.      - Site Reliability: Design for operational quality, monitoring and maintenance      - Monitoring and sanity checks of IT-services, using metrics to improve performance and quality      - Catering for data driven operational insights       You will work in a fast-paced, dynamic and forward-thinking environment.As a DevOps Engineer you are also a part of various forums meeting on a regular basis to share knowledge and exchange thoughts and ideas.       Requirements      As a DevOps Engineer you need to be technically skilled, preferably you have experience working as a developer and from operations.In this role you are responsible for the digital development logistics from start to finish as well as for operational IT-services and it is up to you to make sure you are one step ahead.You enjoy responsibility and you are skilled at communicating your ideas to stakeholders.Formal requirements for the role include:      - 2+ years’ experience working as a developer      - Experience from implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines      - Experience in utilizing metrics to drive improvements      - Experience in cloud environments (preferably Azure)      - Experience in presenting business- and technically-oriented         As a DevOps Engineer you will be part of an agile team so being a team player is essential and key to deliver high quality cost efficient IT-services.         Between 21 dec- 7 jan, the selection process may take longer than usual due to Christmas holidays.We will handle all applications as soon as possible when we are back!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Automation is the key to success for any organisation.At Schibsted Enterprise Technology providing the right tools and guidelines is of vital importance in order to gain speed on the deliveries of our division.We are looking for people that embrace automation, are innovative and love to help others delivering both better and faster solutions.      We run our services on AWS and apply CI/CD mechanisms.      We strongly believe in continuous improvement of always-on systems and we work relentlessly to achieve near complete resiliency in everything we do.This means no actual user downtime, seamless infrastructure and service upgrades as well as being proactive to issues.      So come and join our DevOps team to be at the forefront of active systems engineering and development.      Responsibilities:       - As part of Enterprise Technology within Schibsted you will advise this technology group as to which technology stacks / cloud / big data solutions to use.    - Automate the operations and production of distributed systems so that eventually, no manual intervention is needed.    - Help develop a state of the art platform as a service solution, using the latest and greatest technologies and approaches (e.g.Mesos, Docker, Microservices, etc.)    - Help develop the best possible continuous delivery pipelines supporting features like an automated promotion to production, automated canary releasing or blue-green deployments.    - Work in close collaboration with the engineering organization, making sure that they follow the infrastructure guidelines that you have set and help them make design/reliability tradeoffs as well as implement systems that fail over gracefully and transparently to clients.    - Implement monitoring and logging solutions that enable the production systems to be monitored 24/7.    - Respond to requests from engineering by building self-service solutions    - Make sure that any tech solution that you put in place is robust, will scale and that failover/BCP systems are in place.    - Install, configure, fine-tune and optimize technology solutions.             - Experience working with AWS.    - Strong analytical / problem-solving skills.    - Strong *nix background.    - The ability to write scripts for automation (Perl, Python or similar).    - Proven ability and experience of developing applications (Golang, Java, Python, Ruby or similar).    - Experience of designing and building systems that scale.    - Experience with modern continuous deployment tools such as Jenkins, Git, Puppet and/or Chef.    - Great team player.      We offer you:       - The opportunity to shape the solutions that connect people so that Schibsted can continue to build great products.    - Amazing colleagues.    - Work in a modern IT environment on a global scale.    - Plenty of challenges and opportunities.    - Personal development plan.         Schibsted Enterprise Technology is the global IT company within Schibsted Media Group, delivering services, tools and infrastructure to the entire group and all +8000 employees worldwide.The teams within Enterprise Technology are responsible for Schibsted’s internal IT and infrastructure, providing the core foundation for Schibsted’s market leading brands, including some of the biggest newspapers and marketplaces in Sweden, Norway, France and several other markets.      So come join us in scaling up Enterprise Technology to the next level, accelerating the digital transformation in Schibsted by creating increased efficiency and collaboration!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Är du insatt i och fascinerad av begrepp som Docker, Container, Kubernetes och microservices?Är du den passionerade nörd vi letar efter?I såna fall välkomnar Knowit Quality Services dig med öppna armar och lovar att du får fortsätta utmanas inom spännande projekt och uppdrag.Här får du varje dag möta ett gäng likasinnade konsulter som brinner för sitt jobb och ständigt strävar efter att leverera bästa möjliga kvalité till våra kunder!      Arbetsbeskrivning   På Knowit är Test och Quality Management ett tydligt fokusområde.Som DevOps-konsult hos oss kommer du ha stort fokus på kvalité och jobba med flera kunder inom olika branscher.Du kommer både jobba på plats hos kunden och i projekt som utförs från vårt kontor i Malmö.Arbetet kommer mestadels ske inom Öresundsregionen men resor kan förekomma.      Du kommer arbeta i agila team som kontinuerligt utvecklar, bygger, testar och driftsätter funktioner för att korta projektets feedback-loopar.I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår också att analysera behov, kommunicera affärsnytta och implementera förbättringar inom Continuous Delivery samt ge förslag på tekniska lösningar utifrån kundens miljö och förutsättningar.      Bakgrund   För att lyckas och trivas i rollen som DevOps-konsult hos oss tror vi att du har:      - Minst 3 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och/eller testning av komplexa system   - Programmeringsvana inom något utav Java, JavaScript, C# eller Python.   - Erfarenhet av automationsverktyg såsom t.ex. Selenium, JMeter, SoapUI etc.   - God erfarenhet av verktyg inom configuration management, bygg och deploy t.ex. Git, Jenkins, Docker, Nexus.   -Meriterande om du har jobbat med molntjänster som Amazon AWS eller Microsoft Azure tidigare.      Personlighet   Här letar vi efter dig som drivs av att undersöka och hitta lösningar i komplexa system.Förmodligen är du analytisk, initiativtagande och noggrann i ditt arbete.Förändringar är något som driver dig framåt och du går gärna till jobbet med inställningen att leverera ett ännu bättre resultat än igår.      Ansökan   Känner du igen dig?Skicka då in CV och gärna en kort beskrivning av dig själv direkt.   Observera att vi inte tar emot eller hanterar några ansökningar via mail.      Kontaktpersoner

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Position Summary   Infor is looking for a (Senior) DevOps Engineer to join the Infor M3 development organization, in the MFS (Mobility for Field Service) and CLM (Customer Lifecycle Manager) team in Linkoping, Sweden.The mobile applications MFS and CLM, allows end-customers to perform several business-processes using mobile devices.Both products are integrated towards the ERP system M3 as well as other Infor products.   Key Responsibilities   As a (senior) DevOps engineer you will work on Continuous Integration, deployment automation in cloud (AWS), Docker, and many other aspect of cloud and on premise deployment.You will work within a multidisciplinary agile development team in close collaboration with skilled software engineers, QA engineers, architects and business analysts.You will be an integral part of software development and have opportunities for professional development.   Infor employees have:   • A sense of urgency - Conduct your work with intensity and speed.Huddle fast.Make fact-based decisions.Use good judgment.Keeping the initiatives moving.Repeat.   • A passion for customer success – Be responsive.Follow through on promises.Reject mediocrity.Be obsessive about doing better.Be accessible and communicate proactively.Be selfless.Work as One Infor.   • A thirst for innovation – Be curious.Be a change agent.Some ideas will prove out, and other will not.Fail fast.Iterate.Stay ahead of technology.   • A focus on results - Never ignore results and facts.Learn and adjust.Focus on quality in all that you do.Do more of what works; less of what is not working.Invest your time in value creation.Act like an owner with an adaptive, entrepreneurial spirit.   • A sense of community - Show compassion and caring for others.Be socially responsible.Be inclusive.   The information above is not complete and may change once joining Infor in future but this is a guide of the overall role.Please find further information here: http://www.infor.com/   About Infor   Infor is a $3B enterprise software provider and strategic technology partner for more than 90,000 organizations worldwide.Infor is owned by Golden Gate Capital and Koch Equity Development.Our software is purpose-built for specific industries, providing complete suites designed for progress – for individuals, businesses, and across networks.We believe in the beauty of work, the importance of relationships, and the collective power of ideas to drive significant positive change.   Designed for Progress incorporates two powerful concepts:   •	Design, which represents Infor’s commitment to designing with purpose and intent so our work reflects the changing behaviors and expectations of our users and how they view the world.Our goal is to empower both individual employees and organizations by putting users first, building beauty into everything we do, and redefining expectations for the way software looks, feels, and functions.   •	Progress, which Infor defines as partnering with customers to drive significant positive change.We are proud of the role we play in helping organizations move forward with their own visions of progress, whether that means small steps that make every day a little easier or giant leaps that impact mankind.   From our deep investments in the future to our commitment to making customers successful every day, everything about Infor is designed for progress.Our Values Set Us Apart

headline: DevOPS Engineer
description.text: Electrolux presents   Look for opportunity.Bring it to life.      For us, going to work everyday has an even greater purpose than putting the latest product or technology on the market.It’s about improving the everyday lives of millions.By being brave and open for new ideas – we can push the boundaries for cooking, cleaning and wellbeing at home.But to keep doing so, we need more people who want to innovate and re-imagine what life at home can be.      DevOPS Engineer      Are you passionate about helping to architect, design, implement, build, and deploy code in an environment that challenges preconceived ideas?Does solving complex business problems and real world challenges interest you?Do you thrive in a dynamic entrepreneur environment that constantly pushes you to be the best you can be and more?      If you want to be part of a supportive and innovative environment, come join our growing team.See what Electrolux can do for your career and your journey.Our product uses components built in R, Python, Scala, C++ and Node.JS but we are constantly evolving.      You will      As a DevOps Engineer you will build, deploy and maintain our cloud environment for analytics  / OR maintain storage infrastructure and analytical clusters in a cloud environment.Azure is being evaluated currently but could also be AWS or IBM cloud.The maintenance includes configuring and tuning of services like Kafka as message bus and ingestion system, spark as machine learning platform and execution framework, yarn for resource management, Cassandra, MongoDB and Elastic search for NoSQL queries, Hive on Tez and HBASE for other data access.The work will also include working with Electrolux cloud operations team to manage the different services around analytical clusters for linage, security, backup, monitoring, authentication and more.You will also assist in the complex tooling for development, code versioning, build process, bug tracking and unit testing.      Education and Experience   • Automation is in your blood, and thorough familiarity with Unix scripting, Puppet, Chef and other languages are a critical survival skill.   • Experience in software engineering eco systems.   • Your experience helps you learn and adapt to new technologies and changing situations quickly.   • As part of a cross-functional agile team, you advise on the hidden operations and automation tasks buried in our backlog.When any team ships code, you are already trying to spot potential performance issues and planning tests.   • You bridge software development and systems management, and with strong communication skills, you are not scared to roll up your sleeves and help debug a development issue in the corporate IDE.   • As a development team member, key technologies include Visual Studio including team foundation server, Jenkins, Ansible, Maven, and Git experience building out and scaling in cloud environments is a must.   • Experience with configuration and maintenance of common mentioned open source systems like Spark, Hive, Cassandra, Kafka, Hbase,   • Experience with one or more of the primary Hadoop distributions and/or HDInsights from Microsoft.   • 3+ years’ experience with UNIX-like operating systems; installation and patch administration in an Internet services environment.   • Experience with configuration management (Ansible, Puppet, Salt, Chef, etc.)   • Working experience with Bash, Python +1 other scripting language   • Proven ability to automate common administration tasks.   • Bachelors of Science or related technical degree in Computer Science, Information Science.   • Experience working with distributed technologies and web server farms.   • Strong ability to document standards, methods and produce drawings of environments.

headline: Devops Engineer
description.text: Who we are   We are a small fast-growing company and a family.We are continuously taking market shares and are among the leading companies in the Nordics at building smart recrutiment tools.What all ReachMees have in common is a passion for simplifying our users' lives and helping them succeed in their jobs - to find the right talent for their own companies and recruit them effectively, professionally and fairly.In that, the development process is central to our future growth and expansion outside the Nordic region.   The role   In the role as a Devops Engineer at ReachMee you will work together with our engineering teams to design, build and maintain our infrastructure, delivery pipeline and monitoring capabilities as well as the various tools we use to operate our technical platform.You will work in an agile environment with a strong focus on automation, reliability and continuous improvement.This role involves a lot of responsibility in designing and taking our technical platform to the next level.   As a team we also emphasize learning and development and meet in hackathons, book circles, tech lunches and in our Meetup-group TeachMee where we host talks about Python.All suggestions are welcome and we keep adding new interesting things as we go along.   Who are you?   For this role we imagine that you have a few years of previous experience within DevOps.As a person, you have a proactive and quality-oriented mindset, are eager to learn and have a strong drive to constantly improve things.You enjoy working in a cooperative and cross-functional environment and are generous in providing support and sharing knowledge with your colleagues.   Required skills:   • Continuous Integration in Jenkins or similar   • Linux and networks   • Cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud or Azure   • Basic programming skills, for example in Python, Ruby, Go or Java   • Knowledge of automation platforms such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef or Terraform   • Security   About ReachMee   Our over 650 customers are from both the private and public sectors and the solution is used by large as well as smaller companies, including McDonalds, Försvarsmakten, Sweco, Chalmers University, Apoteket and Scania.ReachMee has its headquarters in Stockholm, but we are also located in Oslo, Helsinki and Kiev.

headline: DevOps engineer
description.text: see also https://www.praqma.com/stories/devops-engineer/      At Praqma we have a strong collaborative culture and invest heavily in developing our people.We are currently looking to hire a DevOps engineer to our Gothenburg office.      As a DevOps engineer at Praqma, you will collaborate and consult with some of the leading businesses in Scandinavia.Our business model is not like your average resource consultancy, we pride ourselves on providing consultants with deep expertise as engineers, but who also come as part of a team.You can read more about our principles and way of working in this article: Working at Praqma      About the position   A DevOps engineer at Praqma works closely with the customer to improve their development process.In practice this can mean setting up automated server provisioning and deployment automation for both production and test environments.It can mean setting up Continuous Delivery pipelines and build automation.The ambition is to train and mentor the customer’s own staff, so we leave them with the skills and knowledge to operate everything we set up.      Consultants with Praqma do not spend all their time at the customer.We invest a lot of time in training, attending internal and external courses and conferences.In addition you are expected to spend time on pet projects, reading books, listening to podcasts, researching topics that interest you, and writing blog posts.      Skills and experience   The below list of skills is wide-ranging and we are not expecting people to be expert with everything.We’re looking for deep experience and skill in a one or two of these areas, coupled with ambition and curiosity to learn some of the others.In each area the technologies listed should be seen as examples not exclusive requirements.      Containerization and Virtualization: you may be experienced configuring Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, VirtualBox or VMware.   System Administration: you may be experienced at managing a server park based on Linux, Windows or in the cloud with AWS, Azure or OpenStack.   Build Automation: you may have set up build systems using Jenkins or Go.CD together with Maven, SBT or Gradle   Configuration Management: you may be skilled managing Git servers, ClearCase, Mercurial or Subversion, together with Nexus or Artifactory.   Software development: you may be skilled with Java, Python, C/C++, Ruby, Perl or Javascript.   The successful candidate(s) will join our Gothenburg Office.We have interesting and challenging customer assignments waiting for the right people, and a wealth of support and experience to draw on from the other seven Praqma offices around Scandinavia.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text: Plejd AB is looking for a DevOps/CloudOps engineer to join our developer team in Göteborg/Mölndal.      Ideally you enjoy a healthy mix of back-end development, Linux and open-source wizardry and a love for all things DevOps, automation and cloud security.      Come join us if you share our passion for working on cutting edge technology and want to help enable our vision to make the best smart lighting and home automation system in the industry.      Plejd is an awesome fast growing Swedish tech company that develops products and services for smart lighting and home automation.We are an in-house fullstack company that has a great mix of people from production, hardware devs, embedded devs, app developers and cloud/backend devs.      You will like it here if you:   -Have an interest in designing and developing next generation cloud infrastructure for highly scalable and available cloud applications   -Like keeping up with state of the art technology and the ever growing ecosystem around open-source, cloud-native and DevOps   -Are hands-on and thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment where you will be a key member of the team      You will mostly be:   - Evaluating overall production infrastructure in the areas of web services, database, and others in AWS environment.   - Helping to seamlessly scale production level systems   - Creating secure AWS based solutions and independently implement them in a timely manner   - Developing monitoring and logging solutions   - Monitoring performance and stability for our cloud-platform and proactively resolve issues as they arise   - Collaborating with internal development teams to create requirements and deliver solutions      We do not except you to know everything in the list below but it may serve as a good list of reference for some of the technologies you will need to learn or know about:      Cloud Architect experience in the areas of:   - Deployment automation   - High availability systems   - Cloud security   - Key/configuration management   - AWS CloudFormation   - Serverless architecture   - ElastiCache (including Redis)   - NodeJS environments   - ElasticSearch      HTTP and Network protocol knowledge:   - Load balancers   - Reverse proxies   - NATs, DNS, VPNs   - WebSockets   - REST APIs      Monitoring and Logging:   - ELK stack administration   - CloudWatch   - NewRelic      Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery technology:   - Jenkins   - GitLab CI/CD pipelines      If this seems like the kind of environment you would like to work in, get in touch!      Plejd AB is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity.Please, no phone calls or emails.

headline: DEVOPS ENGINEER
description.text: THE CHALLENGE      We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to create strategic solutions for managing the production and development infrastructure of our world-class gaming platform, implement and improve technical operations best practices.      You will be working in an agile environment and in close collaboration with developers as part of a DevOps team supporting our gaming platform.The platform is central to the company strategy as it manages all our brands.      It is built using technologies such as WEB API’s, NoSQL databases, Kafka.We are continuously pushing our products to the next level so the focus is always high on quality, reliability, performance and scalability.Currently we are making the journey towards containerization based on Docker, Kubernetes and .NET Core.      WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?      Growth.We don’t like to stand still and neither should you.In this role you will have the opportunity to learn from a network of skilled colleagues.You will be encouraged to come up with new ideas and work with a wide variety of technologies, whichever is best for the task at hand.      Fun.?No matter how busy we might get, there is always time for play!You will be enjoying lots of events at the office and suggesting new things we could try out?together.??      A FLAVOUR OF WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING      Defining and implementing modern containerization and cloud solutions      Continuously improving and developing our CI/CD pipelines      Close involvement in the software development process, supporting developers with things like deployment, building and optimizing code      Using and integrating a wide variety of technologies and tools      YOU’RE GOOD AT:      Optimizing existing systems for scalability and building large-scale infrastructure      Distributed systems, micro-services (Docker, Kubernetes) and service discovery      IaaS and PaaS Cloud (AWS, Azure, OpenStack) and hybrid environments      Building and improving CI/CD pipelines      Server virtualization (VMware)      Automation and scripting      Optimizing code      Windows, Linux      Collaboration and taking initiative      EXTRA AWESOME:      A development background, with experience in C#/.NET      Messaging and push methodologies like Kafka, SQL etc.

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text: Automation is the key to success for any organisation.At Schibsted Enterprise Technology providing the right tools and guidelines is of vital importance in order to gain speed on the deliveries of our division.We are looking for people that embrace automation, are innovative and love to help others delivering both better and faster solutions.      We run our services on AWS and apply CI/CD mechanisms.      We strongly believe in continuous improvement of always-on systems and we work relentlessly to achieve near complete resiliency in everything we do.This means no actual user downtime, seamless infrastructure and service upgrades as well as being proactive to issues.      So come and join our DevOps team to be at the forefront of active systems engineering and development.      Responsibilities:       - As part of Enterprise Technology within Schibsted you will advise this technology group as to which technology stacks / cloud / big data solutions to use.    - Automate the operations and production of distributed systems so that eventually, no manual intervention is needed.    - Help develop a state of the art platform as a service solution, using the latest and greatest technologies and approaches (e.g.Mesos, Docker, Microservices, etc.)    - Help develop the best possible continuous delivery pipelines supporting features like an automated promotion to production, automated canary releasing or blue-green deployments.    - Work in close collaboration with the engineering organization, making sure that they follow the infrastructure guidelines that you have set and help them make design/reliability tradeoffs as well as implement systems that fail over gracefully and transparently to clients.    - Implement monitoring and logging solutions that enable the production systems to be monitored 24/7.    - Respond to requests from engineering by building self-service solutions    - Make sure that any tech solution that you put in place is robust, will scale and that failover/BCP systems are in place.    - Install, configure, fine-tune and optimize technology solutions.             - A BSc (or equivalent) degree in computer science.    - AWS expertise.    - Strong analytical / problem-solving skills.    - Strong *nix background.    - The ability to write scripts for automation (Perl, Python or similar).    - Proven ability and experience of developing applications (Golang, Java, Python, Ruby or similar).    - Experience of designing and building systems that scale.    - Experience with modern continuous deployment tools such as Jenkins, Git, Puppet and/or Chef.    - Great team player.      We offer you:       - The opportunity to shape the solutions that connect people so that Schibsted can continue to build great products.    - Amazing colleagues.    - Work in a modern IT environment on a global scale.    - Plenty of challenges and opportunities.    - Personal development plan.         Schibsted Enterprise Technology is the global IT company within Schibsted Media Group, delivering services, tools and infrastructure to the entire group and all +8000 employees worldwide.The teams within Enterprise Technology are responsible for Schibsted’s internal IT and infrastructure, providing the core foundation for Schibsted’s market leading brands, including some of the biggest newspapers and marketplaces in Sweden, Norway, France and several other markets.      So come join us in scaling up Enterprise Technology to the next level, accelerating the digital transformation in Schibsted by creating increased efficiency and collaboration!

employer.name: Schibsted Sverige AB

headline: DevOps R&D Stockholm
description.text: Vi vill bli fler inom vårt stora satsningsområde R&D!Därför söker vi dig som har arbetat ett par år med DevOps och som gillar att lösa problem.      Du blir en del av ett team där vi arbetar med framtidens tekniker redan idag, delar kunskap, säger VI istället för JAG och ständigt utmanar varandra.Skicka in din ansökan idag och ta chansen att bli en del av oss!      Vi är problemlösare av högsta rang och mjukvara i produktutveckling är det roligaste vi vet.Känslan av att ha knäckt en riktigt svår nöt är oslagbar.Känner du igen dig så finns det ingen tvekan, det är här du skall vara.Att ha kul på jobbet är en av de viktigaste sakerna som leder till att man gör ett bra jobb och trivs.Vi har kul!         Vad ger vi dig?   Våra kunder finns inom alla olika typer av produktutvecklande företag och vi jobbar med allt från den senaste telekomtekniken till uppkopplade och autonoma fordon, vilket gör att du kan vara med och välja vilka utmaningar du vill hjälpa till att lösa.Hos oss får du möjligheten att utvecklas och lära dig nya saker hela tiden.Du sätter själv ribban för hur högt du vill nå - vi ser inga begränsningar.      Många av våra kunder är i en stor förändringsresa där deras mjukvara flyttas upp i molnet, de går från att deploya sällan till väldigt ofta.Det våra kunder behöver hjälp med är att få till hela processen kring CI/CD.Vilket uppdrag du än väljer och i vilken form har ingen betydelse, du vet ändå att du kommer att jobba i teknikens framkant och pusha gränserna för vad som går att göra.         Hur ser din bakgrund ut?   För att passa rollen som DevOps hos R&D tror vi att du har kunskap inom några av dessa tekniker:   - Jenkins (eller liknande)   - Docker   - Kubernetes   - Jira   - AWS eller Azure   - Kunna scripta alternativt ha utvecklarbakgrund      Dina personliga egenskaper är viktiga för oss så därför tror vi att du är en problemlösare som älskar ditt jobb.         Hur är Sigma som arbetsgivare?   Vår företagskultur är stark och något vi är stolta över, därför är dina personliga egenskaper extra viktiga för oss.Vi har både affärsmässighet, kundorientering och teknikintresse i blodet samt givetvis en förmåga att snabbt ta till oss ny information och omvandla den till kreativa lösningar.Vi respekterar alla och tar gärna till oss av andras erfarenheter samtidigt som vi gärna delar med oss av våra egna.Vi tror att mångfald främjar kreativiteten och hjälper oss att växa både som personer och företag.      Sigma IT Consulting är det största företaget inom Sigmakoncernen och vi jobbar enligt ledorden Passion and Execution.För oss innebär det att vi älskar det vi gör och vi får det gjort.Vi vill också vara med och skapa en bättre morgondag för oss alla.Tillsammans kan vi göra detta.      EXPECT A BETTER TOMORROW         Ansökan   Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan via länken nedan.Vi har inte möjlighet att hantera ansökningar skickade via mail.      Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande.

headline: DevOps Engineer Automation
description.text: Om rollen vi rekryterar till?      I rollen som DevOps Engineer inom Automation kommer du att utveckla och förvalta automationer och automationsplattformar inom ICA koncernen.Vi jobbar med tekniker som ligger i framkant; Robot Process Automation, Artifical Intelligence och ChatBots av olika slag.      En vanlig dag på Automation Competence Center innebär standups, sprintplaneringar, utveckling i samråd med ett öppet och härligt team samt förvaltningsåtgärder på den plattform vi nyttjar.      För att lyckas måste du vara nyfiken, tänka öppet, hantera variabel arbetsbelastning och ha en stark vilja att lära dig nya områden snabbt.      I dagsläget exekveras ICAs automationsresa i programform och du kommer vara i ständig kontakt med teamet, som pratar engelska och svenska, samt stora delar av ICAs verksamhet i din roll som utvecklare, där det även finns möjlighet att ta lead inom ett visst programområde.      Du kommer ha stora möjligheter att själv utforma rollen och påverka arbetet.

headline: DevOps Engineer Automation
description.text: Vi söker dig som vill vara med och leda ICA mot en mer agil och DevOps -kultur i vår nystartade avdelning Cross-Functional Services.Inom denna avdelning jobbar vi med automation, integration, devops, IoT och arkitektur.Vårt fokus ligger på att öka utvecklingstakten, automatisera och att se till att ICA ligger långt fram inom avgörande teknikområden.Vi behöver växa, bli fler och rekryterar olika kompetenser.Här är en plats där vi utvecklar entreprenörskap, ledarskap och teknikintresse.            Om rollen vi rekryterar till?      I rollen som DevOps Engineer inom Automation kommer du att utveckla och förvalta automationer och automationsplattformar inom ICA koncernen.Vi jobbar med tekniker som ligger i framkant; Robot Process Automation, Artifical Intelligence och ChatBots av olika slag.      En vanlig dag på Automation Competence Center innebär standups, sprintplaneringar, utveckling i samråd med ett öppet och härligt team samt förvaltningsåtgärder på den plattform vi nyttjar.      För att lyckas måste du vara nyfiken, tänka öppet, hantera variabel arbetsbelastning och ha en stark vilja att lära dig nya områden snabbt.            I dagsläget exekveras ICAs automationsresa i programform och du kommer vara i ständig kontakt med teamet, som pratar engelska och svenska, samt stora delar av ICAs verksamhet i din roll som utvecklare, där det även finns möjlighet att ta lead inom ett visst programområde.            Du kommer ha stora möjligheter att själv utforma rollen och påverka arbetet.            Din Bakgrund      Vi söker dig som är sugen på att lära dig mer om ICA, att lära sig nya saker i snabb takt samt att vara med och göra skillnad och hjälpa ICA nå sina mål i digitaliseringsresan.      Du har arbetat i Linux-system tidigare samt utvecklat i Java-liknande språk.      Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet eller kunskap i agila arbetssätt och metoder så som DevOps.      Slutligen är det meriterande om du är van vid att arbeta i verktyg som JIRA, GIT, Maven etc            Din ansökan   Ansök så snart som möjligt då urval och intervjuer sker löpande.         Vi arbetar löpande med urvalet och välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjligt .            Var inom ICA kommer du jobba?      Cross-Functional Services ingår i ICA IT Services.IT Services levererar koncerngemensam IT till ICA koncernen.ICA Gruppen är ett är Nordens ledande detaljhandelsföretag med verksamhet inom mat och måltider, bank, apotek, specialvaror och fastigheter.Vi utvecklas som IT-organisation och driver bland annat projekt inom Automation, IoT, Big Data, säkerhet.Har du specialistkunskaper med bredd finns det möjligheter att vara med att utveckla och att utvecklas själv i våra projekt

headline: DevOps R&D Stockholm
description.text: Vi vill bli fler inom vårt stora satsningsområde R&D!Därför söker vi dig som har arbetat ett par år med DevOps och som gillar att lösa problem.      Du blir en del av ett team där vi arbetar med framtidens tekniker redan idag, delar kunskap, säger VI istället för JAG och ständigt utmanar varandra.Skicka in din ansökan idag och ta chansen att bli en del av oss!      Vi är problemlösare av högsta rang och mjukvara i produktutveckling är det roligaste vi vet.Känslan av att ha knäckt en riktigt svår nöt är oslagbar.Känner du igen dig så finns det ingen tvekan, det är här du skall vara.Att ha kul på jobbet är en av de viktigaste sakerna som leder till att man gör ett bra jobb och trivs.Vi har kul!         Vad ger vi dig?   Våra kunder finns inom alla olika typer av produktutvecklande företag och vi jobbar med allt från den senaste telekomtekniken till uppkopplade och autonoma fordon, vilket gör att du kan vara med och välja vilka utmaningar du vill hjälpa till att lösa.Hos oss får du möjligheten att utvecklas och lära dig nya saker hela tiden.Du sätter själv ribban för hur högt du vill nå - vi ser inga begränsningar.      Många av våra kunder är i en stor förändringsresa där deras mjukvara flyttas upp i molnet, de går från att deploya sällan till väldigt ofta.Det våra kunder behöver hjälp med är att få till hela processen kring CI/CD.Vilket uppdrag du än väljer och i vilken form har ingen betydelse, du vet ändå att du kommer att jobba i teknikens framkant och pusha gränserna för vad som går att göra.         Hur ser din bakgrund ut?   För att passa rollen som DevOps hos R&D tror vi att du har kunskap inom några av dessa tekniker:   - Jenkins (eller liknande)   - Docker   - Kubernetes   - Jira   - AWS eller Azure   - Kunna scripta alternativt ha utvecklarbakgrund      Dina personliga egenskaper är viktiga för oss så därför tror vi att du är en problemlösare som älskar ditt jobb.         Hur är Sigma som arbetsgivare?   Vår företagskultur är stark och något vi är stolta över, därför är dina personliga egenskaper extra viktiga för oss.Vi har både affärsmässighet, kundorientering och teknikintresse i blodet samt givetvis en förmåga att snabbt ta till oss ny information och omvandla den till kreativa lösningar.Vi respekterar alla och tar gärna till oss av andras erfarenheter samtidigt som vi gärna delar med oss av våra egna.Vi tror att mångfald främjar kreativiteten och hjälper oss att växa både som personer och företag.      Sigma IT Consulting är det största företaget inom Sigmakoncernen och vi jobbar enligt ledorden Passion and Execution.För oss innebär det att vi älskar det vi gör och vi får det gjort.Vi vill också vara med och skapa en bättre morgondag för oss alla.Tillsammans kan vi göra detta.      EXPECT A BETTER TOMORROW         Ansökan   Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan via länken nedan.Vi har inte möjlighet att hantera ansökningar skickade via mail.      Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande.

headline: DevOps. till Dustin
description.text: Detta är rollen för dig som har ett intresse för att arbeta med infrastruktur, automation och säkerhet och som vill arbeta med att förbättra och automatisera webbplattformen.På Dustin är sammanhållningen hög och i teamet får du chans att arbeta med kompetenta kollegor som alltid ställer upp för varandra.Läs mer nedan för att se om tjänsten på Dustin passar dig!   OM TJÄNSTEN   Academic Work söker just nu för Dustins räkning en DevOps.till deras Infrastructure and Operations team, bestående av sju personer som ansvarar för hela koncernens infrastruktur.I rollen som DevOps kommer du att arbeta med webbplattformen och vara bron mellan infrateamet och webbteamet.Ditt fokus kommer att vara att förbättra och underhålla webbplattformen, arbeta med automatisering och continuous delivery.   Du får arbeta med kompetenta och seniora kollegor som har lång erfarenhet och om du vill jobba i en dynamisk organisation med bra sammanhållning och stort engagemang så är Dustin helt rätt arbetsplats för dig.I teamet är stämningen hög och alla ställer upp för varandra, något som bekräftar Dustins kärnvärdering "Win as a team"   Som chef är jag tydlig, inlyssnande och lösningsorienterad och i rollen handlar det inte om antalet timmar som du är på jobbet utan om de resultat du levererar."   Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Academic Work men du kommer att anställas direkt hos Dustin.Dustins önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till    Academic Work.   ARBETSUPPGIFTER   Du kommer bland annat att:   * Förbättra och göra underhållsarbete webbplattformen   * Automatisering av webbplattformen   * Hantera infrastrukturversamheten   * Koordinera webbaktiviteter inom infra-teamet   I början kommer arbetet främst att bestå av att få webbplattformen och integrationerna att fungera, för att sen automatisera och sätta upp nya miljöer.I dagsläget finns en senior konsult på plats som kommer finnas kvar för överlämning så att du på ett bra sätt kommer in i arbetet.   VI SÖKER DIG SOM   * Har en master i systemteknik eller motsvarande   * Har minst två år relevant arbetslivserfarenhet   * Har ett intresse för att arbeta med infrastruktur, automation och säkerhet   * Har mycket goda kunskaper i engelska i både tal och skrift, detta då engelska är koncernspråket på Dustin   Det är meriterande om du har certificeringar (t.ex AWS Certified SysOps Admin, Certified Kubernetes Admin CKA, Puppet Certification) samt om du har kommit i kontakt med liknande arbetsuppgifter tidigare.   Som person är du van vid och trivs med att arbeta självgående.Du tar ansvar för att dina arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden drivs framåt mot uppsatta mål.I rollen kommer du ha många kontaktytor varav din samarbetsförmåga kommer vara avgörande för att du ska lyckas.Vidare är det viktigt att du är öppen för konstruktiv feedback kring ditt arbete och inte tar detta personligt.   Övrig information   * Start: Omgående, med hänsyn till eventuell uppsägningstid.   * Omfattning: Heltid.Flexibel kontorstid   * Placering: Nacka Strand, Stockholm      * Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Dustins önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till   Academic Work.   * Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på Ansök nedan.Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.   Skriv annonstiteln i rubriken och kopiera gärna in länken till annonsen i ditt mail.För generella funderingar kring din ansökan/vår rekryteringsprocess finns vi ofta tillgängliga i chatten här på webben under vardagar så hör gärna av dig där!   Om oss   Academic Work är Home of the young professionals.Det betyder att de flesta av våra jobb är relevanta för dig som studerar på högskola/universitet eller för dig som är klar med dina studier och är i början av din karriär.Hos oss kan du arbeta som konsult på uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, bli anställd direkt hos ett kundföretag via vår rekryteringsverksamhet eller börja jobba internt på något av våra Academic Work kontor.Läs mer på www.academicwork.se.   INFORMATION OM FÖRETAGET   Dustins framgång bygger på att det är ett bolag med fokus på tillväxt och entreprenörskap och har utvecklats i takt med marknaden och våra kunders förändrade behov.För att de ska kunna fortsätta vara framgångsrika strävar de efter att jobba tillsammans och vinna som ett lag.Därför är Win as a team deras kärnvärdering.Läs mer här om Dustins kärnvärden och varför inte passa på att spana in din kommande chef Dennie på LinkedIn?   Förutom bra kollegor och utvecklingsmöjligheter erbjuder Dustin även friskvård och har ett wellness team som ordnar olika aktiviteter för dig som anställd.Här går det bra att träna på lunchen både i ordnade aktiviteter eller på Sats som ligger precis utanför dörren.Här  kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba på Dustin!

headline: Mjukvaruutvecklare - DevOps
description.text: Om dig   Du som söker är ständigt hungrig på att lära dig mer om hur man kan effektivisera infrastrukturen kring mjukvaruutveckling och motiveras av att få genomföra och se förändringarnas resultat.Vi värderar dina personliga egenskaper högt.För att lyckas i arbetet måste du ha en förmåga att förstå helheten och identifiera ingående delar som behöver förbättras.      Om rollen   Vi söker dig som hittar effektiva lösningar och sätter ett högt värde på att kunna leverera mjukvara snabbt, ofta och smidigt.Genom att samarbeta med utvecklingsteamen, QA och våra kunder kommer du få chansen att bli en nyckelspelare med stora möjligheter att påverka både de interna och externa processer som genererar värde för våra användare.      Dina arbetsuppgifter   Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bestå i att bland annat administrera och utveckla molnlösningar (AWS och Azure), ansvara för att hålla CI-processen uppdaterad och ha en förståelse för hur vårt REST API kan struktureras på bästa sätt för att möta morgondagens behov.Organisationen finns både i Sverige men även i andra länder, vilket gör att kommunikation och samarbete är en viktig del av arbetet.      Om företaget   StruSoft AB är ett programutvecklingsföretag med målet att förse byggbranschen med bästa möjliga mjukvara.Förutom utveckling och försäljning av programvara arbetar StruSoft med forskning, support och utbildning.StruSoft bildades 2002 av 13 medarbetare från Skanska IT Solutions.      Idag är StruSoft ett lönsamt och dynamiskt växande företag med ca 100 anställda i 6 länder, med egen programutveckling i Sverige, Danmark, Ungern och Indien.StruSofts program är väl etablerade på marknaden, och används idag av fler än 10.000 användare i mer än 20 länder runt om i världen.      Om programmet   IMPACT är en programvara som sammanför design, produktion och projekt för en prefabricerad betongstomme i realtid.För design används Revit, Tekla, AutoCAD och BricsCAD som grafiska plattformar.Dessa integreras via en webbtjänst med egenutvecklad grafisk plattform för projekt, produktion, logistik och mobila enheter.      I Sverige, Norge och Danmark är programmet marknadsledande och används av både konsulter och fabriker.Programmet är också etablerat i övriga Europa, Mellanöstern och Asien.      Kontakt

headline: Consultant - DevOps
description.text: DESCRIPTION      Are you an experienced hands-on Cloud and DevOps Architect who can assist our customers in designing, developing and re-architecting application and IT infrastructure to fully leverage the AWS Cloud?Do you like to work on a variety of cutting edge, business critical projects, at the forefront of cloud infrastructure, DevOps, and application development?   AWS Professional Services is looking for highly talented hands-on Cloud and DevOps Architects to assist our customers develop technical expertise and deliver meaningful business outcomes.Professional Services engage with customers across EMEA.This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.            Job Description   As a Cloud and DevOps Architect in AWS Professional Services, you will help customers innovate and overcome technical challenges by developing and delivering reliable and scalable cloud-based solutions.From greenfield best-practice architectural guidance, to resolving deep technical issues and complex problems, to real-world production-ready implementations, you will work across a range of technical areas including scalable and resilient cloud infrastructure, automation and provisioning, testing and deployment, monitoring and logging, and security.   AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners.Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to get the right solution delivered for our customers, to advance the possibilities of the AWS platform, and to innovate based upon our customer's needs.As a Professional Services Consultant, you will engage with the technical, IT and software leadership of our customers.You will help architects and developers to innovate even faster and be more cost effective using the latest cloud technologies.   We invest heavily in our team by continuously offering learning opportunities, sharing knowledge internally across all technical teams in AWS, and working on (customer & internal) projects that will broaden and deepen your technical knowledge.   If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, are eager to deliver results, are deeply technical, highly innovative, and a voracious learner, it is you who we are looking for!            Major Responsibilities   · (Re)architect solutions to use cloud native technologies and modern architectural patterns.   · Design, develop, and evaluate highly innovative solutions that are scalable and reliable.   · Teach fellow developers how to develop high-quality code, innovate using the latest (cloud) technologies and development best practices.   · Review architecture designs and implementations, suggesting and delivering improvements when needed.   · Solve deep technical issues and develop solutions that extend service capabilities to meet customer needs.                     BASIC QUALIFICATIONS      · 5+ years of experience as a software engineer or DevOps architect.   · Strong track record of delivering projects of significant complexity & scale.   · Ability to gather customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.   · Ability to mentor other software developers on modern DevOps and architectural concepts.   · Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, deployment, release and change management).   · Proficient designing and building highly available, resilient large-scale distributed systems.   · Prior success in automating real-world production environments.   · Automation experience in large-scale production environments (e.g.Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible).   · Experience with source code and software collaboration technologies (e.g.GitHub, GitLab, Atlassian suite, Mercurial, Perforce).   · Experience configuring and managing continuous integration servers (e.g.Jenkins, Bamboo, TeamCity, VSTS).   · Strong scripting skills (e.g.Powershell, Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl).   · Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewalling.   · Strong practical Linux and Windows-based systems administration skills in a Cloud or Virtualized environment.   · Very strong analytical and problem-solving skills.   · Excellent communication and presentation skills, oral and written.   · Strong team-player, willingness and interest to collaborate and work well in a team.   · Strong sense of customer focus, ownership, urgency, and drive.   · Ability to travel to client locations across EMEA when needed.Up to 50%.         PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS      · AWS Experience   · Experience with back-end technologies for web applications/APIs.   · Experience developing robust, highly scalable distributed systems.   · Experience with IT Strategy & Consulting services.   · Familiarity with logging and monitoring infrastructure (e.g.ELK, Datadog, New Relic).   · Experience with automated testing tools (e.g.Selenium, JMeter).   BA/BS degree or equivalent experience; Computer Science or Math background preferred

headline: DevOps Engineers TV
description.text: Who we are   We’re here to connect you to what matters most, and by doing so, empowering societies.As a Telenor employee, you will be part of a large, international organisation that goes beyond customers – we want to play an important role in the societies we serve.Being connected can change your life, and we’re serious about helping our services make the widest possible impact.   We are looking for driven and collaborative  persons to join our TV team.Telenor is rapidly heading towards the digital future and we are looking for people with a natural proactive drive who wants to make a difference.Read more about Life at Telenor here.   What you’ll do   TV as a service is changing rapidly and streaming and other services integrate more and more with each other.People have different ways of consuming TV today and that is a challenge that Telenor will embrace.Telenor will take next step in the future services in the TV area and need new engineers that can strengthen the TV-services team.Your contact areas within Telenor are many, such as Consumer, Networks and IT Tribes.Your role is to define and communicate requirements as well as technical possibilities and limitations.   Examples of your responsibilities        * Act as subject matter expert in development projects that involve the TV  platforms or service        * Be the expert in how to develop and integrate legacy services with other systems        * Contribute as a member of the DEVOPS group TV-services  in the Networks department        * Participate in RFQ processes and provide technical recommendations and vendor selection support        * Supervise that the TV platforms and integration is according to IT security internal regulations        * Develop the security and testing of the streaming apps in cooperation with partners   Who are you   You are used to acting on your own initiative, making things happen and taking responsibility for the outcome.You are a team player who works effectively with others, who shares knowledge and information and supports others in the pursuit of common goals.Your ability to quickly analyze complex questions and problems is very good.Furthermore, you are interested in continuously developing in the expert role.You have ability to present new and inventive ideas and solutions, and you can respectfully challenge traditional approaches.Finally, you are a very good communicator who communicates clearly verbally as well as in writing, creating reports and documentation.You have  a Master/Bachelor of Science in Telecom or IT, or equivalent work experience and are fluent in Swedish and English (both written and verbal   We’re looking for candidates which have more or less competence/experience in the following:        * Linux operating system administration and architecture        * Architecture and developing against TV DRM systems        * Terminal OS like Android, IOS and TVOS        * Tools used in the app's life cycle - such as the Google Play Store, iTunes AppStore, Testflight, Crashlytics and like.        * API- technologies like JSON, XML, REST and such        * Micro services in docker and such        * Metadata processing and systems        * Streaming platform design and function        * Subsystems like Elastic suite, Splunk   Our promise   A balanced workforce is key to our success.To secure that, we’re committed to fostering a working environment where our employees are supported and empowered in all areas of their work.We promise you a company eager to learn and rapidly adapt to a digital world where you will be welcomed into a skilled team of professional and knowledgeable colleagues.In addition, you will get:        * A flexible way of work - have a lunch workout without having to rush back, be able to leave/pick up the kids from school, work from home when you need to?This is no problem if you make sure your team is happy and you perform and deliver your work.        * A generous health and benefit package with for example wellness grant, health insurance, ”give me a break”-days, employee discounts, regular health checks, occupational pension and much more.        * Development programs to deepen your knowledge and broaden the competence.   Come join us now      Application deadline: 2019 February 4th   Location: Stockholm, Solna Råsunda
