headline: DevOps systemutvecklare i Sthlm, Gbg, Umeå, Malmö eller Borlänge
description.text: Den här tjänsten handlar helt om att utveckla Bahnhofs infrastruktur, och kräver någon med tidigare erfarenheter och kunskaper på området.Ditt arbete kommer utgöra en viktig del i Bahnhofs pågående transformation för att hålla oss i framkant av IT-marknaden och den tekniska utvecklingen.      Eftersom din avdelning är placerad på olika kontor är det självklart att alla ska ta sitt ansvar i att dokumentera arbetet, och aktivt söka upp varandra för att dela kunskap, kritik och idéer med varandra, och vi förväntar oss detsamma av dig.      Dina arbetsuppgifter   - Utveckla, designa, underhålla och sätta upp nya och gamla tjänster, applikationer, API och annat relaterat till våra IT-miljöer, med bred exponering mot DevOps, moln, servrar och nätverksinfrastruktur.   - Arbeta projektbaserat som del av ett utvecklingsteam, även i samarbete med Bahnhofs övriga tekniska avdelningar.   - Söka upp, isolera och lösa problem och återkommande arbetsmoment i samråd med dina kollegor, men gradvis alltmer självständigt.   - Motta och genomföra idéer och uppgifter från dina kollegor på utvecklingsavdelningen, och andra nyckelpersoner inom organisationen.   - Övervaka, analysera och säkerställa bibehållen integritet och sekretess i nätverk, serverparker och plattformslösningar i samarbete med Bahnhofs övriga tekniska avdelningar.
description.conditions: Heltidstjänst som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning. Din arbetsort är antingen Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Umeå eller Borlänge – det hela beror på var du befinner dig och vilken stad du helst arbetar i. Bahnhof har minst ett kontor i alla fem städer.

headline: Cloud DevOps and Infrastructure Engineer for Packet Core ( 256203 )
description.text: Job Summary:   We are now looking for a Cloud DevOps and Infrastructure Engineer to maintain and develop an efficient development environment for the Cloud Packet Core product.Your role will include all development activities such as: requirement analysis, system design, architecture design, software design, integration, verification, simulations, tools design, Product Lifecycle Management support and product documentation.We stand at the forefront of Agile software development, using methods like Lean and Scrum to create a product that excels.Early customer and stakeholder feedback is a key element in our development process which is based on Continuous Integration SW practices.We rely on team collective responsibility to complete all tasks according to an established backlog priority.      To expand our organization’s capacity, we are looking for ambitious, intelligent, creative and inspiring individuals to join us.We provide a fun and challenging environment where you can grow and help to inspire your colleagues to further growth.      Responsibilities:   •You will drive strategic technical leadership and 5G Core interests in Ericsson communities   •Perform continuous analysis and requirement handling   •Develop and test high quality tools and environments   •Integrate open source   •Perform advanced trouble shooting   •Drive continuous improvements of environments, tools and processes   •Develop competence, docuement and teach in technical domain

If you are a Senior Full-Stack Developer and have a significant interest in .NET development and agile working methods, then maybe this could be the right challenge for you.In this role you’ll have the freedom to manage yourself and when convenient work remotely from your home office.   Your responsibilities   Most of our solutions are business critical and requires high performance and high maintainability.The focus areas ahead are to further develop the solutions with modern cloud-based technology and improve automation of tests.   You will be part of a development team where you will be working with a focus on development deliverables, system requirements, testing, support and release management. Your profile   We are looking for a full-time .NET Full stack developer who has significant experience in Amazon AWS and DevOps.You should have a degree in IT, complemented with a minimum of 5 years development experience with at least 1-2 years’ experience in AWS.   It is meritorious if you have experience in .NET Core and micro-service architecture.   • We expect applicants to be curious, have excellent problem-solving skills and to have a genuine interest in developing good IT solutions.   • You’ll need to have excellent communication skills to be able to keep everyone in your team on the same page.   • You know how to plan your work like a pro and hit all your deadlines.By taking the time to plan each project effectively, you can become an invaluable asset to your company and yourself.   • It is an advantage if you have worked/are working in a lead role.   • As the corporate language is English, you need to be proficient in written and spoken English.   Our development culture   We are a medium-sized team that moves fast and iterates.We run code reviews, testing, and are currently working on achieving a continuous deployment infrastructure on Amazon Cloud.We put a lot of emphasis on code style, cleanliness and robustness.You will get to work with excellent engineers and you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on our way of working, vision and IT targets.   You will get to work with the latest technologies out there and continuously improve our processes and deliverables.We will never limit your creativity, never shut down ideas before testing them with customers and we will never be boring!   We embrace distributed development as a core tenant of our corporate philosophy.When a project requires collaboration we use shared workspaces, screen sharing, and voice over the internet to enable real-time discussions.   If this sounds like a team you’d love be a part of building, and you’ve got the skill set, please get in touch with us.We’d love to hear from you!   The location   We are one of the first groups within Scania to try the Remote Worker concept.Currently we are in a pilot phase with two of our developers working fully remote.Depending on the outcome of this pilot setup, we will offer the possibility of working remotely within Sweden in this role.   We offer   In addition to exciting career and personal development opportunities, we offer Scania employees a competitive salary and other benefits, performance bonuses, a pension plan, flexible working hours and much more.
